Governor Michelle Lujan Grisham
March 27 at 12:36 PM ·

My administration made the very difficult decision, in close consultation with educational and health leaders, to extend public school closures through the rest of the academic year. We have to continue to take very aggressive steps to mitigate the spread of COVID-19.

We know this has tremendous implications for families and students all across the state. ACTion Programs for Animals
March 8, 2019 at 9:44 PM ·

The fifth grade Gifted Services group at the John Paul Taylor Academy conducted a community service project for us. They collected dog, cat and office supplies, including toys and food. They also sold Valentine's grams at the school and raised $600, which will go toward our vet care expenses for our rescues. Families, teachers and other staff supported the cause. Last month, students took a ride on the Roadrunner bus to our adoption center for a tour and to visit with the cats and dogs they were helping. And today, the group presented the check and donations to members of APA's board (written by students Gaia Incendio-Van Tongeren and Maggie Collins).
We GREATLY appreciate the generous support!

We would like to invite you to join us at our monthly Parent Advisory Committee meeting, tonight February 13th at 6:00pm in the Media Center.

What happens at a PAC meeting???

At each meeting we have members from each group; administrators, governance council members, teachers, and parents. We discuss topics of interest that have come to our attention, talk about JPTA updates, learn about ways to support activities and plan additional activities throughout the year.

One of the many amazing things about JPTA is our school community and sense of family. Being a small school we rely on parent volunteers to help our community thrive.

Come to a meeting, make some new friends and share your thoughts, talents or time with JPTA!

Thank you for your continued support!

Jennifer Rogers, PAC Vice-Chair
